content.body: Is anyone still researching base64 utilities?
bakkot updated the base64 proposal just last week. https://tc39.es/proposal-arraybuffer-base64/
content.formatted_body: bakkot updated the base64 proposal just last week. https://tc39.es/proposal-arraybuffer-base64/

content.body: Thanks, it seems that has the relevant issues that need to be solved as well
I'm getting closer to understanding (and improving) how WebKit handles all of this which should help eventually driving those to some resolution
I am hoping to bring it for stage 2 next meting
* I am hoping to bring it for stage 2 next meeting

m.new_content.body: I am hoping to bring it for stage 2 next meeting

content.body: currently leaning towards, the decoder will be lenient in accepting whitespace / not enforcing `=` padding, and the encoder will be strict in not producing whitespace and always producing `=` padding
content.formatted_body: currently leaning towards, the decoder will be lenient in accepting whitespace / not enforcing = padding, and the encoder will be strict in not producing whitespace and always producing = padding

content.body: and then maybe not having options for those, unless there's a compelling case made
I was originally planning on having options for how to handle whitespace and `=` but they're probably not actually necessary
content.formatted_body: I was originally planning on having options for how to handle whitespace and = but they're probably not actually necessary
